number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												This game feels like an early access game even though it is stated not to be one.It is definitely NOT worth the 25 euro's they are asking for it. It is an unfinished at best and unplayable at worst game. It has some gamebreaking bugs that make this game a chore rather than a pleasure to play.For starters, I had troubles even getting the game to work. The store page states that I need a GFX card with half the power my system has to run this game. Even so I had frequent stutters and a LOT of crashes. I spent hours trying to fix this game. The forums are littered with complaints about crashes, many of which have not had any answer whatsoever by the devs.Eventually I seem to have found some sort of half-arsed solution (since apparently in all cases it's the systems fault NOT the game, when it crashes) which causes my game to only sometimes crash.Now that I have got my game running (kinda) I face all the other issues:1. Laying train tracks and stations is tedious beyond comprehension. If you can even find a way to place a track, don't think about removing it and placing it again, because it changes the landscape permanently. Yes you can fix this with the landscape tool, but why would I need to?2. Placing lines seems to work fine at first but is then met with many complications. Oftentimes resulting in trains not moving at all. There are workarounds for this, but they require manual interference rather than the AI just being clever enough to figure things out themselves. This should be something that works intuitively, but rather than that, it require hours of finetuning just to get 1 train track to run half-decent.3. The game has massive framerate issues. As stated before I ran this game on a card with more than enough power. I set all the settings to the lowest possible. I lowered the resolution and STILL I had frequent drops in framerate. Once again I went to the forums to check if there was a solution and once again I was met with "You need to update your system" rather than "Our game is not optimised properly".Overall this game just feels very sub-optimal. The way you would expect an early access game to feel. If I were to play this, not knowing in what stage this game is, I would say late-alpha, early beta.All that said, the developers ARE updating this game regularly, including performance updates, but I don't get my hopes up too high, since this game has been out for a while and has had many updates and still doesn't run well at all.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												I'm afraid that I cannot recommend this game after several hours of playing it.There are some positives, and one massive negative (which I'll get to in a minute):+ The line layout is simple and intuitive, it actually does work pretty well... by and large. There are a couple of oddities here and there (particularly if you've got stations on both sides of a road, for instance) but these are easily resolved.+ The individual track laying mechanism is a great idea. However, it does come with quite a few caveats.+ Gameplay is pretty straightforward, you gotta get things from point A to point B, but be prepared as you may lose money at first.And now... the big negative:The amount of time that I have spent getting frustrated with trying to build rail bridges over roads is getting ridiculous. I've pretty much given up on the game because the editor is a pain in the butt to work with.Thought process as follows goes:"Ooh, this looks like a good place to cross over the road. It's perfectly straight and there's plenty of room to do it!"But then...NOPE. Can't do it. Nope, nope, nope, the terrain editor will find it absolutely UNACCEPTABLE and you can't build it. Never mind that the approaches look fine, everything looks fine, and argh, I just give up.Want to build a nice, compact rail overpass that *doesn't* require pillars? Nope, not gonna happen, may as well forget about it.For now, I can't recommend the game, but this will probably change IF the developer is interested in actually fixing the many issues with the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												For a game called "Train Fever", the execution of the namesake is just not very good. Simple cargo-truck, bus, and even tram lines are plenty workable. However, when you start trying to build railways, you run into lots of intractable problems:1. The handling of elevation in rail tracks/stations is not good. Stations seem to be elevated off the surface of the map (and the terrain raised), or recessed into the ground, for no obvious reason. It's hard to build tracks between relatively near stations, because the system wants to build them at a high slope.2. Trains often have trouble finding their way on really straightforward rail routes, even when you're using things like waypoints. Conflicts between trains are far too common, and the use of signals is complex and fraught with peril. Basically, forget about having more than one train per track, and expect persistent headaches at terminus stations.3. It's possible to end up in a state, especially on multi-train lines, where your trains are PERMANENTLY stuck and you simply must revert. That's unacceptable.4. Train Fever doesn't let you do anything with elevation, except in the form of the afterthought hacks in the path-finding phase during build. No elevated or subway trains, making it hard to do much better than streetcar/tram light rail in the cities.5. The cities grow so slowly that they never really arrive at the sort of scale that makes a transit system a fun challenge. On easy, you build a few cargo lines, cash in and watch the money stream in. On the harder difficulties, it's a challenge to make headway at all.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
												This game is frustrating beyond belief! I was a hardcore OpenTTD and CIM2 & 1 player and managed to achieve massive and functional cities but this?! This thing right here is just plainly stupid. It tries to wow you with nice graphics and at first you might fall for how great it looks but you just wait for this bug fest! Btw. this is my first ever hate comment and first game ever to make me so angry. I really tried to overcome countless amount of problems but it's just impossible.First of all UI is just terrible. Windows can't be resized, they pop up in random places (sometimes beyond your screen), buttons are tiny, everything requires loads clicking especially if you manage to grow your corporation to a decent size. Developers recently added auto renew option to your lines. Great. It doesn't change the fact that you still have to manually click on every line and chose which car/train you want to use as your new vehicle. What if a new model is researched? Well, repeat that whole process. Is it really that difficult to think and allow to select many lines rather than just one and make batch changes to them?Other UI problems include little things like the fact that when changing a name of your line you have to always press and hold backspace to delete a default "line 1" name. You can't select what you've written, you can't copy it, you can't move your cursor. Basically you can't do anything that Notepad application can. Little things but wait until you have 100s lines and want to do some simple cleanup.Bigger errors include things like a lack of save menu! I mean this is just ridiculous. When saving you have to type your name and that's it. You can't select a previous save so if you make one spelling mistake you will create a new save file or what's worse you can easily ovewrite a different game. You can't load a game from any other screen but main menu and all auto save files are mixed with your regular ones so it's just a massive cluster ♥♥♥♥.Enough about a terrible UX. How about the game itself? I said already that it looks great but that's about it. There is absolutely no AI. ZERO! Your vehicles will move along set paths and that's it. It doesn't matter that there might be other vehicles blocking it, if it's stuck it will be stuck forever and you won't know because obviously there is nothing that would inform you.Your trains will always stop on the same platforms. There is no point in building big train stations because computer will always use the same place to load and unload which is totally ridiculous as there might be 5 billion trains waiting in line to one platform while there are 7 other available. You might think that maybe I need to build signals? I tried. I really tried but this game only has 2 and all they do is let or stop a train. They won't direct to a different track, they won't do anything useful. You need to have them so your silly train drivers won't crash into one another but you can't use them for anything useful. Just bloody terrible!Building roads and tracks is just totally unbelievably idiotic. Route finder will prefer to build massive, stupidly high bridges or long tunnels and claim that it's cheaper that just laying a road on a hill. You also have to lay paths in separate segments and seems like height is applied to a whole section so you end up with these ridiculous lines that costs a fortune and totally wrecks surroundings because computer seems to mix uber high bridges with total destruction of nature. Same with depots and other structures (not that there is many of them). If you put one down on a slight hill, you won't get a gradual terrain alignment, you'll get a fricking cliff in the middle of a city that looks weird as hell.But the worst of it all is cargo. First of all there are only 4 types which you can increase with mods but that doesn't change the fact that factories doesn't follow any rules at all. They sometimes won't produce anything while suggesting that you can increase manufacture by shipping more of the produce. How am I supposed to increase sending of ZERO??!! Then they'll say that line is in no use even if city is accepting resources and all of them are properly connected.That's actually another thing. There is no explanation to how all of these things work. No tutorial no nothing. If there was a wiki made by developers that would in depth describe the engine of this game maybe you could understand why certain things are happening but at this point it's just a massive lottery. Loads people are speculating on the internet and share their experiments but no one knows for sure. For example there is apparently a 20 minutes limit on waiting time for a cargo to be picked up but I only know this from players that observed such behavior.You don't know how population is transferring, you don't know why cargo is not moving, you don't have any proper stats, there are no good overlays, you can't even set your trains and truck to unload outside their dedicated destination (like a transfer station), performance is ridiculous even on high spec computers and more and more issues.Seriously, this game is more like an Alpha then anything else. It's not even about bugs which there is plenty but about the whole way this game works. How in 2015, can you make a product that is waaaaay worse than Railroad Tycoon 2 that was launched 17 years ago!!! It really annoys me that Steam is letting things like this go. Is there zero quality control?+ Graphics are pretty nice but ruined by things like ghost buses and horse carts, people waiting on bus stations in a perfectly aligned grid and disappearing if there is too many of them and of course trains and buses reversing in place.- everything above.This game has a great potential but god dammit there is still a lot to do. Shouldn't be released by any standards.

												don't botheri want to really like this game because it fills the gaps that made railroad tycoon just plain silly. e.g. proper grading, realistic looking tracks and trains. it's a more realistic approach to railroad tycoon. that is where it ends. the interface sucks. it gets very slow by the year 1990. i have most of the map full of bus, train, and tram routes. now we're presented with the double standard of living, people want faster routes or to drive cars instead, similar to real life, excellent right? the problem is, the road system is very lacking in that traffic jams up very easily, then guess what happens: all your bus and tram route times are slowed by a lot, making them even less desirable, and causing even more traffic! don't use tram or busses you say? get bent :Pfurthermore, you end up upgrading the entire road infrastructure yourself. in the cities, many of the roads can't be upgraded to 4 lanes because the computer built all the structures around it, collision errors, etc..building tracks is painful. even after building a ton of train lines, i still have to fiddle around way too much, to either make proper grading or solve 'terrain' issues. trains can also get stuck indefinitely if you are not careful.. you'll see.the graphics aren't superb either, other than zooming down to city streets, it's a rather drab landscape that doesn't feel alive. it's a very good attempt, but this is not ready for primetime. replacing the game engine is probably a good start

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 9, 2015
												This game looks clearly unfinished. There are trains but not much fever :)PROS:Nice visuals, especially when it comes to the terrain. Railway cuttings and embankments look very realistic. Individual people also change their attire as time passes by, which is an interesting touch.Modding support, allowing the users to download additional game content.An American DLC (Free) allowing you to run the simulation in the different environment.The game is very stable and can happily run in the background as you strive to do more important things on your PC :)CONS:Building multiple tracks or a station throat is a nightmare. Modernizing the track layout is next to impossible.You cannot rebuild a station - add a new platform, goods yard, extend the platform length. Once you want to do so, you need to demolish the existing building and make space for your next one - which includes bulldozing a lot more. Occasionally, the bulldozed space is immediately filled by a new structure, forcing you to repeat the operation again.You cannot build railway crosssings other than laying track across the road. You are not allowed to build a street crossing an existing track. And should you prefer to build an overbridge instead, you will need a lot more space to run your street above the tracks.Modding support is... well, flawed.  I needed to reinstall the game and the TF Game Manager (mod manager) after the latter had crashed, rendering my installed mods invisible and thus unable to be enabled (sic!) for my current game. Mods are not used automatically - must be enabled first, then selected when starting (or loading) a game.Strange selection of trains. In the vanilla game there are only 14 locomotives available for the entire game period, and only 4 of these are available for the 50 years of 19th century. One needs to wait until 1902 to see an engine attaining 100kph speed. Well, I believe that GWR's City Of Truro did 102,3 MPH (that's 165 kph) in 1904, and a lot of British trains had their running speeds in the range of 100 kph well before the turn of the centuries. The LNER A4 Mallard is a curiosity since there is no other British railway vehicle (and only two other non-German/Swiss). No Patentees, no French Cramptons, no French Atlantics or Pacifics, no DRG Einheitslokomotiven, no TEEs. No Shinkansens. Again, this may be corrected by modding, but... see above.Intermodal passenger transport does not work. Once you place the station in the city, other passenger transport in this city is rendered unnecessary - somehow all the citizens immediately want to travel to other cities and will go by foot to your station, avoiding any connected bus/tram line. It seems that building the intercity connection changes the behaviour of citizens to look for their work/leisure targets somewhere else than their home city.The game is essentially eventless - once you build your intercity connection, money starts flowing in and that's all. No competition, no breakdowns, no crashes, almost no interaction required other than occasionally replacing the ageing vehicle.No proper savegame screen. You must specify a filename when saving, and there is no warning if you overwrite any previous file of that name.Resource hungry. My 3rd Gen i5 laptop with 8GB RAM and 1GB GT525 is barely able to run the game full screen; with full details I achieve single fps. The same laptop can run Arma II, The Bureau: XCOM Declassified and Ultimate General Gettysburg on recommended settings with no trouble.The game may appeal to German railway fans (or maybe Swiss railway fans), of which I am neither. With the American DLC, it may also appear to American railroad fans, again not to myself. Since the developers are updating the game, perhaps some of the mentioned problems may be fixed. But currently at the standard Steam selling price, it seems grossly overpriced.

												I liked it but I knew when I was going in that it was a one-dimensional railroad SIM. The mods really flesh out the options available otherwise the gameplay is simple: start with closed bus loops -> fund your rail lines -> wait for next epoch to unlock new trains.Graphically, the game looks fantastic, but unless you are running a top of the line vid card, you will experience stuttering and slowness when the game has to start tracking more vehicles and lines.All that being said, if you like an open ended train SIM with lots of options for reskinning then go ahead and pick this up but if you are looking for an in-depth, modern Transport Tycoon give this one a pass.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												don't botheri want to really like this game because it fills the gaps that made railroad tycoon just plain silly. e.g. proper grading, realistic looking tracks and trains. it's a more realistic approach to railroad tycoon. that is where it ends. the interface sucks. it gets very slow by the year 1990. i have most of the map full of bus, train, and tram routes. now we're presented with the double standard of living, people want faster routes or to drive cars instead, similar to real life, excellent right? the problem is, the road system is very lacking in that traffic jams up very easily, then guess what happens: all your bus and tram route times are slowed by a lot, making them even less desirable, and causing even more traffic! don't use tram or busses you say? get bent :Pfurthermore, you end up upgrading the entire road infrastructure yourself. in the cities, many of the roads can't be upgraded to 4 lanes because the computer built all the structures around it, collision errors, etc..building tracks is painful. even after building a ton of train lines, i still have to fiddle around way too much, to either make proper grading or solve 'terrain' issues. trains can also get stuck indefinitely if you are not careful.. you'll see.the graphics aren't superb either, other than zooming down to city streets, it's a rather drab landscape that doesn't feel alive. it's a very good attempt, but this is not ready for primetime. replacing the game engine is probably a good start

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 22, 2015
												While I commend the developers for flexibility with construction in this game, it's as if it was never play-tested. It's impossible to use. There are no "standard" game features/controls I would expect. Such as ESCAPE to bring up the menu and/or quit. I used the "Windows Key" to bring up the desktop then force quit with task manager. The menu for the game is completely non-functional while in-game, clicking settings highlights the button and does nothing. The menus are constantly in the way and disable the mouse scroll so if I move the mouse over a menu while trying to scroll the board, it doesn't move the map, I have to move the mouse around and in-between the menus to scroll - super frustrating. The tutorials do little to help you get started and are constantly in the way. The placement of all the menus is terrible and they cannot be moved around. When I finally did get something working, I somehow managed to use up all $3M with a train depot and a single straight piece of track, left unable to purchase cars or figure out how to get citizens to use the newly built lines. The load this game puts on my computer is extreme and causes lag and this is a gaming PC with dual graphics cards, SSDs, fully loaded. I'm extremely frustrated and probably won't play this game again. Good thing I got it on sale.---- NEW BELOW ----After quite a lot of tinkering around, I've finally got 3 trains up and running, and lines for them to follow. I determined the menus don't work on a multi-monitor desktop PC, when I loaded this game on my laptop, the menus showed up on-screen. I've also figured out a work around for the scrolling problem, don't put the menus up against the edge of the screen and your arrow has room for scroll - big oversight on the developers if you ask me. I'm still not very pleased with the interface, it's incredibly clunky, and I'm not getting used to it. As for game play, I did manage to figure out the loan program to get enough funds to complete rail between 2 cities, and add some bus stops within the cities to get people to my stations, then paid off my loans so I can just build now in the black.Due to the enormous amount of problems and glitches with this game, I still have to rate it a thumbs down. Here's hoping for significant updates at some point.

number of helpful: 40 of 84 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												I was excited to see a new entry in the train econ simulater genre, unfortunately what we got was a half finished game.The game performs terribly, very slow and stuttering.  Construction of lines is fussy, with constant complaints of obstructions and missed connections.  It is certainly not as smooth and simple as the demo videos show.  Navigating the 3D landscape is frustratingly slow and laborious, no overview map to see the land.  Lots of scrolling in and out.   When you scroll out you cannot be close enough to the terrain to edit, but when you scroll in you cannot see where you are going to build your lines.The game is basically a 3D copy of Transport Tycoon.  Taking the worst aspects of Transport Tycoon and combining them with the annoying 3D interface of Railroads!.  The game suffers from billions of pop up windows, just like transport tycoon.  The interface looks unpolished and poorly thought out.  Add to that the difficulty of interfacing with a 3D world and the limitations that full 3D puts on map sizes and you have a dissapointment.   If you are looking to build continent spanning empires, go grab the original Railroad Tycoon series and skip this.  The game lacks any story line and is simply an impersonal generated map, with no specific goals, needs or other driving factors.Overall it feels unfinished, unpolished.  Like a game engine without a game behind it.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												-- addition to review -- We just had the multithreading patch, the game has seen some improvements for sure. But IMHO, the core problems from my initial review still exist. And even though gridlocks have been noticable patched, they havent been fixed. They are still there, just less. Graphics/Sound is all good. Simulation has its problem and illogical parts, which can become problematic at times.-- original review --I would have to say it was worth my money considering how many hours I have spent on it, on the other hand the value of that time was taken down drastically by the problems the game has on a simulation level and with its tools. And considering this game has little to no value for a quick 3h game, but is meant to played for many hours I would have to say it isn't worth it as once you reach a level where it starts to get interesting the nuissances become problems. Graphics/Sound/Music was fine. But the core of the game, its simulation is just bad.Not to badmouth the game, cuz they could still fix things, but to support my negative review here goes a list of things I have encountered: Laying down roads or rails often results in "collision" without clearly specifying what is colliding leaving the user to guess what to demolish. Using the "Load All" option can actually cause your line to be ignored completely. The amount of traffic that buildings generate can bring the traffic in the city to a grinding halt, so that bus routes become so slow that they arent used, causing probably more cars to spawn. You can only draw rails over roads, but not roads over rails or rails crossing rails. You sometimes can build a ridiculous 45 degree slopes, but most other times a 5 degree slope will give some error that it's too steep. There are also some very unbalanced issues. I've seen situations where building a road on fairly flat land cost more to raise lower ground for road than it was to build a bridge over it. Loading bays can hold equal or less to the trucks you have ( in late game ).  2M to remove a football field with 2 bleachers, but 700k to remove a 14 story building. And more of these weird inbalances. I've seen a (in-game) months worth of cars get priority to cross an intersections, while the busses that were the first in their lane never moved an inch. The UI is really lacking in many ways and there is little feedback to the player. Something as basic as visual feedback on the signal states isn't even in the game. I could probably name a few more.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2016
												Very little to do, the AI (particularily the pathfinding) is essentially broken, no ability to control vehicles or lines in any way beyond stopping or starting specific vehicles, your control over track/item placement is sketchy at best.A nice illustration of the AI issues is how trains treat unavailable sections of rail.  If you segment your rail into sections like normal, only the section with the other train on it is seen as unavailable.  This is fine.  You build a parallel rail with a crossing immediately before or after the signal for the blocked section, your trains wont divert onto the parallel line, because they are programmed to drive straight up to the edge of the blocked section of rail and simply wait for it to become available again.Its made even wierder by the fact road vehicles and road lines automatically adjust themselves to available roads, so the engine would be capable of making the trains divert, they just decided not to.But yeah, at that point there is literally nothing you can do other than building an entirely seperate other line for each train, which isnt that big of a deal in game since you have more money than you can use, but it is just obnoxious.

Graphical glitches abound so badly that the game becomes completely unplayable because most fo the screen goes black as soon as you try and place a station. What's worse is that the graphical glitches continued even after exiting the game and the steam app. The only way I could get my display to return to normal was to do a hard restart. I have never seen anything like it in 20 years of gaming. 2.0 GHz i7 MacBook Air w/8Gb. What really ticks me off is that I spent $12 on nothing. Totally worthless trash. Glitches and crashes I expect occasionally. Unplayable? I should be able to get a refund.Add to that what little I was able to see did not look impressive. Music was irritating me already. Controls were terrible (I had no choice but to use an external mouse). Expect nothing like what you see in the videos.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												What this game does well; everything looks pretty, lay some very nice realistic track, train modeling and detail is excellent, realistic cargo and passenger movementWhat this game lacks?  Everything that makes a good transport building game fun.   There is no competitive element whatsoever.  No AI and no multiplay compability,  No way to measure yourself against something.  This is a game of survival.  It is impossible to make money at anything besides passenger transport.   It's very difficult to make money running industry in this game.  The cost to maintain your vehicle is outrageous compared to how make it will make on a run. Supply seems to be dictated by how frequent the trains/buses stop at the station.  There seems to be no limit to the loan you can take out ( maybe i just never reached it, but when your 50ish mil in debt it's time to startover )I think this game is suppose to appeal to people that build scale model train sets.  Because that is basically what this is, a game that lets you make very detail and visually appealing track sets.  The towns grow around your track and it's all very cool,  just not that fun.oh and it may be called train fever but if you build trains to start you are almost doomed to go broke right away....

												Pick it up when it's going cheap as this product is woefully short of my expectations for a game costing £19.99.  It's frequently frustrating and poorly explained. number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												There's no demo available for this game - why not? Had I tried this game on a demo, at least I would've been happy as I would have known what I was getting into before buying the game.The UI is hard to get used to. When you put down tracks, quite often instead of going with the terrain, it builds bridges and culverts everywhere. Straight, seemingly flat pieces of land with farmland on them, and it still wants to build a bridge or a culvert. Moving around the interface is very difficult, none of the "windows" have screen movement, so if you move your cursor to the bottom of the screen to scroll down, it only works if there's no windows there - since the non-movable menu icons and the time bar are there, you have to move the mouse down the middle and not the edges of the bottom of the screen to move. If you've opened up another window, say a Depot screen, scrolling down doesn't work if that window is there. Diagonal scrolling is out - if you want to move diagonally, you can't since all four corners have HUD elements that don't have scrolling. Scrolling to the right is even harder - when I scroll the mouse to the edge, the screen doesn't move. Instead, I have to move the mouse so that it's a pixel from the edge of the screen for it to move - assuming there's no window there for line info etc. (for info, yes, I do have Edge Scrolling set to On in options)There's also data bugs in the game. For example, I send a carriage around my first bus route, it passes through a couple stops, only after that second stop did it say "You have your first passenger", and it highlights the bus stop - without actually stopping at that bus-stop. I then got a You have delivered your first passenger" but the bus was still moving and didn't stop anywhere between the two notifications. I have a station with 39 passengers. The train has three carriages for 6 passengers each. When they board, I only have 16 passengers on the train (16 of 18 it reports) and passengers now waiting on the station is 22. I'm like, what?!? Where are those numbers coming from? It also seems that, as that train is moving to the next station, the numbers drop. 15 of 18, 14 of 18... what are they doing, jumping from the train at 40 km/h? That's suicide!Yep, I said km/h. Even though there's all British style names in the game, such as Letchworth Garden City, Totnes and Dursley, the game only allows km/h, there's no settings to change it to mph.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												I came into this wanting a train game where I could set up routes and make money to get new trains and routes, just a basic train tycoon sort of experience. That's pretty much what this game offers, but only at a very shallow level. I'm sad to say it didn't live up to my expectations at all. As a train set it is extremely limited in what you can do and requires extensive time to unlock any eras or vehicles at all to play with. There is no competitive element. So, just what is compelling here?Most of it felt to me very incomplete and broken, with very poor feedback on what systems are doing under the hood and therefore little way to make sense of its failings. Often things just won't work for no reason. It's hard for me to rationalize why this game can't measure up in a fairly dead / abandoned genre, as it seems to have plenty of good ideas and then nothing at all to hold them together. If this were an early access alpha I would call it promising. Instead I'm surprised that this game came out last year and it still hasn't been patched so that track and road laying were not so cumbersome, limited, and fails so often. I can't think of any problems mentioned in Rock Paper Shotgun's review that have actually been taken care of, and it's been a long time and many patches since so just what is happening here where a game is released with serious, unintentional flaws and just keeps them?You'd be better off with Sid Meier's Railroads! or for a single-player transport tycoon experience maybe Cities in Motion 2. This game just feels extremely unfinished and I feel really betrayed that they made me pay 35$ for it. You'd think a 65% user rating would mean something but the rating system has really failed here. I don't know what people are expecting, thign thing is probably way better than Cities XXL and some shovelware tycoon game, but compare it to games that came out in 2006 and it's a real disappointment.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												I want to love this game,but I just cannot. For those of you who are debating about if you want this game or not,read this review,and decide from there. Basically,this games is like a modern day Locomotion or Transport Tycoon,only not as good. Like,at ALL. The game does have redeemable factors,but all the bad things just completely drown them out.Pros:-Good Music: I have to say,the music is catchy and is very Tycoon game-ish.-Decent Graphics: Not the prettiest,but not the most ugly either.Cons:-No Objectives:In games like Locomotion,you played on many different maps each with a unique objective (transport a certain amount of goods,reach a certain company rating,etc.) In Train Fever,however,there is no goal in sight other than "Don't go bankrupt!" which is the barebone objective of tycoon games.-No Rival A.I:No competing companies,no rivals trying to make more money than you,nothing. Just you and yourself,which gets old very fast.-Bad Construction Tools;Something that should be simple and basic is rather clunky and frustrating. Horrible collision detection (I seriously had collision problems with something that was atleast 50 feet from the track),Landscaping controls that use the camera button to take effect,crossing roads and rails is a pain in the butt,and sooooo much more.-Poor Performance:Despite the fact that my computer is very modern and runs lots of other games perfectly,Train Fever constantly lags and often takes a few seconds just to do basic things like move the camera.And finally,the biggest problem of all...-Crashes,Crashes,and more Crashes:Oh.My.God. This game crashes more than a drunk driver. Gameplay consists of 10 minute sperts before a crash,which deletes your save data if you didn't save before. If the crashes were few and far between,it could be forgivable. But they're not. The longest I've ever gone without a crash was about 10 minutes,and although I went even longer without a crash,the game's perfomance dropped even more,so it looks as though to prevent crashing,the game needs to run badly. And to run well,the game needs to crash constantly. Pick your poison,I say! And not does the game crash a lot,but 9 times out of 10,it's going to not just crash the game,but the computer entirely. This game has crashed on me 8 times,and 4 or 5 of those were hard crashes. Not only that,but it once crashed so hard,the crash error screen crashed too. How the hell do you do that!?If you haven't figured it out by now,I don;t recommend this game at all. It's way too overpriced for what it is,and even though I got it on sale for $13,it was still too expensive. Here are 3 better ways to spend that $40:1.Go buy food,clothes,gas,a gift for your sweetheart,anything really.2.Buy a bunch of other games on Steam. I recommend the Five Nights at Freddy's trilogy,Team Fortress 2,and Gt Legends,just to name a few.3.If you stil want your tycoon game fix,buy Locomotion or Rollercoaster Tycoon. Both are timeless classics that still hold up today,and will give you many more hours of enjoyment than this game ever could.

number of helpful: 21 of 47 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												----------------------------------------2014-09-11 update after 58 hours----------------------------------------I stopped playing this game. Where by "playing" I mostly mean figuring out how it works, WHAT in it works and to find workarounds for things that are supposed to work but do not. This is because no game mechnics are explained anywhere. (Frequently reading and participating in the forums, where players exchange knowledge, is the best bet to figure out this game.) And also this is because the game is full of bugs and design flaws. Still. I would be not mad at all, if this game was Early Access. But it is released and financed via crowdfunding.I stoppped playing this game because to me it is more frustrating than fun. Maybe this will change. I am visiting the train-fever website weekly, to see if there is a new patch (and release notes). And I hope I will read, that the bugs that upset me so much, got fixed, one day.But until then I do not recommend to buy this game. I recommend to hold your money and wait, until the game matured.----------------------------------------2014-09-07 after 20 hours of game time----------------------------------------i would like to have my money back. seriously. i would wait half a year and observe if all the bugs and design flaws get fixed and the game gets an overhaul so it is more challenging and fun and less painful and frustrating.i loved transport tycoon back in the early years and today i still play railroad tycoon 3. but train fever at this stage is simply not fun to play. train fever looks nice, in some ways, yes, but there is very little versatility in this game. just 5 cargo types? small maps? very few vehicles? no ai competition? no option to build industries? no financial market options? expensive trains in a train game? the landscape looks the same everywhere? no sandbox mode? (i am not even asking about multiplayer)i miss the fun of competing the ai opponents, ruining them and finally taking over their companies. i miss the fun of managing 30 different cargo types, i miss the fun of watching a lot of different locomotives with different train cars for each cargo type ploughing through the landscape.btw, in train fever you wont have a lot of trains. road vehicles are the main source of income. just on routes with a very high concentration of cargo or passengers, trains are profitable. road transportation is really very dominant. suggesting to rename this game to "road fever" or "transport fever" would not just be a joke.the usability is medium at best. managing a large transport network can be painful. i wont bother you with how hard some advanced goals can be to achieve. but a simple example: you can not build a rail crossing when you want to cross a road over a track. this feature simply is not implemented. you just can cross tracks over a road. meaning, to cross a road over a track, you need to bulldoze the track, lay the road, and then cross the track over it. ... and then there are the bugs. ... disappearing cargo, blocked truck stations, stuck trains, wrong cargo count. ... also the game lags even fast computers, the user interface is ugly and uncomfortable, the music is horrible and better turned off, sound effects are poor. though the graphics are detailed, the landscape looks boring greenish and repetitive.and the gameplay as a whole ...  no goals, no challenges, no missions, no opponents. the only goal is to build the perfect transportation network, grow cities and industries, to increase the need for transportation. ... well to be honest, in this last regard, the game is not very different from other games in this genre.it is the multitude of frustrating things. that make me not like to play this game for now. it needs a huge amount of work to get out of a development-/testing stage.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												Too early to buy! DO NOT WASTE MONEY!Game looks like alpha or early beta. In comparison with Transport Tycoon, but better only graphics, the rest of the game much worse. There are no multiplayer There are no AI competitors Industry chains too short - 2 step, for example: wood -> goods or oil -> goods. There are only 3 chains: 4 row materials and only 3  manufactures game interface is squalor: looks like black on white simple HTML without CSS (ingame windows), some buttons looks like simple text not like a button (start/stop train button for example)  Building railways only by short pieces like on video, if you try longer ones, then game greatly slows down up to slideshow and does not depend on the graphics settings (game runs smoothly on maximum settings except this moments) Manufactures works from game to game differently. One time its works good, and after new game start all manufactures produce maximum 1 piece of resource per year (is it bug or feature?) If you want to buy new vehicle (bus, lorry, tram) to the existing route, you can't just copy existing one - no such option, do it manually no autoreplace to outdated vihicles, so it becomes a nightmare to manually replace them (there are no copy function, see above) if vehicle was sent to depot it loses route, you need set it manually to send vehicle back route names are: Line1, Line2 and etc. With many routes you have a problem to remember all. Sorting in route list looks funny:   Line1,    Line10,    Line11,   ......   Line2,    Line21,    etc game have no icon on windows taskbar (LOL) lights / semaphores  are primitive and does not allow to build ways with heavy traffic like in Transport Tycoon buildings (except crane), manufactures, semaphores have no animationthis list can be continued, but i'm tired... and very disappointed :(

content:
Posted: October 8, 2014
												The game concept is great as is the graphics, though everything is ruined by implementation. Here's major reasons why you'll be disappointed:1. Crazy controls. I mean it. You build double track train line and want to place one way signals along the way, how many clicks this action deserve? 3 clicks for each signal! You want to replace your aging truck fleet? Great, you can seen all of them to depot, but then you need to buy them one by one, assign to line and space them evenly, or they will roam in crowd for their lifetime. Thats just couple of examples, user experience is totally appailing.2. Supply-demand system, It is unbalanced. You can build your 1M$ line + 500K$ train from the oil wells to refinery only to see that wells only produce 1 unit of oil/year, even if the refinery is connected to towns striving for 'goods' (you see, oil well->refinery->town - thats really long production chain), The only way to assess future production is to check whether the industries send their goods on foot by the roads (on my maps its 1/10 of all industries, others lie dormant with 0 production).3. Game spans from 1850 till 2020 and you get only a few engine models. That's could be partialy solved by mods.

content:

												A big dissapointment.  Having followed the development closely since the announcement, I was looking at this as a medium-paced transport tycoon with intuitive controls and a strong element of money mamanagement.  What came out at the end of the tunnel was undoubtedly a beautiful game but the pace is so, extremely slow and it is very difficult to remain enthusastic and keep playing.  The "intuitive controls" are worse than that of CIM2 and Sim City, I found myself getting very frustrated trying to build a basic road when some road or rail section about a half mile away was preventing me from doing it.  A bug? Perhaps but it happens constantly and becomes a burden very quickly.I can go on and on but if you are looking for a Railroad Tycoon/Cities in Motion 2 spin-off or similar game then Check out OpenTTD.  It's free.  I see that the developers will be continuing updating Train Fever which is a good sign, I'll copme back and re-review at some point.  Makle it work the £20 outlay.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Sadly this was one of the titles I was excited over coming out, but for its price it is beaten by the old dogs in the railroad / transport tycoon games.In fact, Railroad Tycoon 2 with its shortcomings will actually excite you more, and is more intutive than this game.That is the game's first downfall, lack of tutorials, or rather a cheapskate way of doing it.The tutorials in game are JUST a sloppy redirect link to the Steam guides for this game, the public directory of Steam guides at that with lackluster content.It works, but the instability of the Steam system will easily give you headaches on some days, and leaving you with ZERO tutorials, or forced to watch a 10 minute video to find out how to rotate a building or station.Which leads us into another problem, zero keybinds, you dislike the rotation of buildings on the N and M key? Tough luck, that is set in stone and CAN'T be changed in the options.Another problem I have noticed is that the audio tends to go wonky and skips during gameplay, this especially evident with the gameplay music if you are opening menu's or the like, and it isn't a lack of performance / FPS, as the game runs nicely elsewhere when scrolling and zooming, but opening and closing menu's triggers it, and may be a symptom of much bigger problems underneath the surface.In short, do I recommend you buy this game? Well it is a refreshing breath into the transport genre, but their competitors who only had the problem of being old, with poor 2D or DirectX 6 or DirectX 7 graphics, will  kick this game hard when it comes gameplay.OpenTTD is a serious contender to this game, and is also under constant evolution, and while it is hard to beat, the devs better shape up and get their act together.EDIT: As a quick update to the latest set of updates rolled out at 22nd of May 2015, the issues STILL stand, except now you can hear the music problem even just idling in the main menu.Steam guides are still used, and Steam is STILL unreliable with frequent downtimes, and the keybinds still cannot be changed.

number of helpful: 1 of 6 people (17%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
												I very much wanted to like this game. I have over 85 gaming titles, including "other" train sims. Many have incredible graphic emersion and I set them all to the highest resolution available. These games run smooth and with solid framerates. (none of them required me to "tinker" with the graphic card or any aspect of my computer to run at capasity)So when I looked at this game I saw that the graphics were not of the same caliber I assumed that running the game would be a breeze for my computer. Wow.. was I wrong.I loaded my first game (Medium map)  and once it loaded I was beside myself at the lag that was present. I thought.. this cant be right... So I tried to dumb down the graphic settings to see if it helped. No change..System Specs:I7 3.00 on an X58 motherboard.24 gig of ramNvidia GTX 580 (2 gig Vram)Win 7 proEven with this level of system resourses the lag spikes make this game unplayable.And I don't understand it. I run Skyrim at full settings, X Rebirth at full settings, Crysis 3 at full settings. and all of them are high end graphical miracles that emerse you into new and amazing worlds.  Train Fever although fun looking does not even come close to delivering this experience. Its a map with roads and rails crossing over them. You dont even get a "ride / follow the train" view. How can a simplistic looking map game harsh my system so bad?Clearly there is something wrong with the game. And I will NOT tinker with my system to make this game work at the risk of making my computer unable to run the other games.When someone buys a new game. they should not have to jump hoops to make it work. The developers need to sort it out within the code. To do anything less will only limit your market share. Not everyone knows how to tinker with system settings.I am very disapointed with Train Fever and I have no choice but to shelve it as an "unplayable game" and move on to another game. I cannot recommend this to anyone and I caution those that are considering buying it.. You WILL be disapointed with the frame rate.

												This game works and I do actually like it but I don't recommend it at this time because it is not finished. There is so much stuff missing that should have been included on release that it is not worth the £20 price tag. The TF forums are flooded with suggestions of what players would like to see included in the game but they are suggesting basic stuff that should already have been included. Modders (god bless 'em) are already hard at work doing the dev's job for them... for free. A minimum 50% reduction in price and I wouldn't have a problem recommending TF as a good purchase with amazing potential.Having said that... 6 days after launch and I still cannot play TF unless I disable my AVG security. AVG flags Trainfever.exe as a Win32/Heur virus and removes it. If I disable AVG, I can play TF.

												More like Bus Fever! Honestly this game has amazing graphics but beyond that this game seems empty and complicated. In order to actually make money you absolutly must start rail or road lines to industrial producers. Your passenger lines in the cities and between cities never really seem to make any money and I always find my frieght subsidizing my passenger lines. There also seems to be no real point to the game. Not in the "It never ends" sense but in the sense that I just make lines, hope they do well and watch the vehicles bounce across the screen. It would have been nice to see some sort of Railroad Tycoon influences. Maybe this game has more to go but if that is the case it should still be Beta. It feels like it.

content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												Probably the first thing you are going to try with this game is putting up couple of stations and laying the tracks. Inserting stations is quite straight forward but when you try to connect those with tracks, the agony... Let me explain little bit more detailed. In principle it is straight forward, you select track and drag it from point A to point B. When you start dragging the line it tries to keep it levelled at all costs, literally. So what I did to keep costs lower, adjust it by the contours. This would even by itself sound tedious, but it's not what made me stop playing.  It was that once I tried to cope with contours the track wouldn't get levelled again. It was raising at steady pace. I couldn't get it to lower at all, raising on the other hand was possibility.Have they tried playing this game before publishing or did they just wish for the best?The game has good concept but at it's current state I wouldn't suggest it to anyone. If they fix the bugs I might even get to core part of this game, but now I'm too irritated to try.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Oh dear. Where do I start. This game has (or rather had) so much potential. Just a remake of Transport Tycoon would have  been enough for most fans. But its just a bad game. Here it goes:- lackluster interface that looks like something you can program in VisualBasic with smallish numbers and UI elements- no AI- weird size ratios between stations and town buildings. Some bus stations are huge compared to the town size- very little economic gameplay, don't expect RR2 levels of management here (on par with TTD though)- no area indicator for stations (really not funny if you want to build bus/ tram lines)- you can't start later than 1850 until you get the achievements. You start out with a horse buggy. Its called TRAIN Fever. TRAINS!!- very unintuitive cargo system, industry buildings are relly small sizewise compared to trains and stations, looks just weird.Here comes the most annoying aspect: Building tracks:Building tracks is similar to RR2 but it does not work out. There are constantly farms. buildings or really small roads in the way. Sometimes it says not enough space. The tool permanently builds cuts or embankments. The whole track looks juist ugly with those. Worst of all you have to build your track in small segments. And don't get me started on double tracks.The problem ist that sometimes you realize that the planned route will not work out (gradients are not well shown on the map) and you need to plan an alternative route. Well, your money is gone...you CAN NOT PLAN your route. How could they not add a route planner for this game. I wasted so much money trying to build track (and buying this game).Stick with OpenTTD. It looks dated but the mechanics are solid.---Have a look at my channelhttps://www.youtube.com/user/phoppe1980

number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 19, 2014
												I've been a huge fan of tycoon games - particularly transportation tycoon games for a really long time. I've been looking forward to Train Fever since I first heard about it. Unfortunately, it has proved to be probably my most disappointing game purchase this year.I think my big issue with Train Fever is that it is just not quantitatively fun. It feels like you are wrestling with the track editor in order to build anything. The challenge isn't identifying where to lay track in order to maximize a profit, but simply in building the infrastructure. A prospect like building a junction between two pairs of lines is almost nightmarish in complexity and difficulty to execute.I've concluded that the developers are huge fans of trains, to the expense of actual gameplay. Things like the actual trains are rendered impressively well, with little things like the coupling rods on the wheels working perfectly. Unfortunately, trains won't route to spread load between multiple lines on a station. You can't lay road across railway lines - it has to be the other way around. You can't do something as simple as have an intersection between two lines without them connecting.The game also lacks anything in the way of charm. The music is not particularly good, and gets repetitive very quickly. The cities and industries feel very lifeless. I compare it to the (admittedly flawed) Railroad Tycoon 4 which used music and graphics to evoke the nostalgia of steam era trains.Could it still become a good game? Possibly, but I doubt it. It feels like it should be in early access, and it feels unfinished. It feels like effort was put into the game, but that gameplay is secondary to just making cool looking trains.Should it be at the $30 price point? Not at this stage.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												I have several different train simulators and games at this point and this is pretty much the worst of them. The in-game help is horrible, disconnected, and basically doesn't get you up and "running". As others have noted, it's trying to jam too much into one game so it feels very half-butted rather than doing one or two things whole-butted. The panning and scrolling are jerky and feel very "shareware" like. The graphics are pretty rudimentary. For example, when creating a tunnel you get an angled mess that looks like a bottomless quick sand pit rather than a nice entrance and exit to the tunnel. Even the main menu looks like a major accident when you change to higher resolutions. Errors are even funnier! You'll get errors like "Not enough space" when you're trying to connect a road to a station...in the middle of a pasture! Or "Collision! Terrain alignment collision. Not enough space" What the heck does THAT mean?When you're building a track, to scroll the landscape you have to continue holding down the left mouse button to lay track while at the same time holding down the right mouse button and moving the mouse in the opposite direction to scroll the screen. Really? Did anyone teach these developers how to write software? When laying track it automatically curves when you want to go straight...and then you get another error messages that have more meaning in a C++ compiler than in a train simulation game. It seems like the designers got into a room and decided on the following tenets:1. Make the help as useless as possible.2. Make the error messages even more useless than the help.3. Make the controls for the UI as useless as the error messages.4. Make the graphics look as close as possible to Pac Man.5. Make the game extremely unintuitive to chase potential customers away so that we can go bankrupt.6. Charge a lot of money so we came make as much as possible before declaring baankruptcy.This wasn't worth the money it cost me, and I would HIGHLY STRESS that if you're thinking about buying this game, invest in a tree stump instead...it'll provide less aggrevation and more entertainment that this game.

number of helpful: 6 of 18 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												Back in the day I played a Magazine Demo of Transport Tycoon (TT) and was hooked. I then went to town and bought the only copy I had remember seeing for sale for a full £30, but it was £30 well spent as it is probably the game I have played the most over the years.Train Fever is a blatant rip-off of the concepts of TT, but is missing quite a few features that were in the original TT, so might be considered Transport Tycoon Lite with better graphics. It is however also missing gameplay aspects which means this game is not very enjoyable. While TT was quite basic I think Train Fever needs a few more features (and perhaps a few unique ones not copied from TT!) to make it less basic.The aim of TT was not really about making money, as once you got past a certain point you would be earning enough to do mostly anything, and spend time refining and increase train lines on routes needing more demand and the upgrade them to Monorail and then Maglev and Subsidies at the start which paid more and would help you get the money rolling in.Subsidies are not included in Train Fever and it only seems to have road vehicles and trains, where TT also had ships and aircraft although this game also does not have any water, so ships will not be possible. Expect to just create a few train lines and then hit high speed and wait until they start making money to be able to create more.Other things missing from this game is competition where TT had computer opponents, even though their intelligence was not always great. Train Fever seems a bit empty and lonely as you are the only transport company in the game.The graphics are nice but the playability just ain't there for me. The railines I have created have all been curvy to avoid mountains and speed restrictions of tighter curves and bending\curving the track 90 degrees seems to be too big\long. Perhaps I am not doing something right but it does not seem to be possible to raise or lower track to be the same level as the terrain, where terrain will be raised on tracks or cut through's will be created through terrain leaving the track level. When it comes to road vehicles I created a bus route with one horse carriage though a busy town but it just lost money and did not make anything - perhaps the early road vehicles just cant and only later in the game with more demand and bigger vehicles. The houses also look incredibly modern for the 1800's. The Music is partcularly good which many tracks having a guitar feel of "The Shadows".As a test, I also tried playing the game with an erection, but this made the game even less enjoyable.I don't think in its current form this game is worth £20. Its more like a £10 game at present.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												Do NOT get this game until they get it right. They said this game was easy to build with. It’s far from it. This game feels like it’s still in Alpha. Things the Dev's need to address before I'd recommend this game.    An UNDO Button. I hate wasting my money when a road or Track doesn’t want to connect. Even with a money cheat this was a pain in the butt. Tracks not connecting where I want them to. I couldn’t make a decent train yard without laying Miles and Miles of track.    I'd like to see drag and drop adjustments when laying a track or road. Example: lay a stretch of track. And being able to move different parts of it before finalizing the track.   Tracks don’t like to merge (RxR) with any road that the PLAYER sets down. I tried leveling the ground, making  a tunnel, and even tried a bridge. Always got a "collision error" or "unusable space", or even “Not enough space”.   A better tutorial. They show you how to get bus's running to get the people moving and how to lay a starting passenger train set up. But they don’t teach you how to get cargo moving or how to merge it to your trains.   A SELL Button in the bus depot. I hate having to make a route just to use the "return to depot and sell" button... Such a pain in the butt.   The Dev's really could take a lesson from Railroad Tycoon. This game has SO MUCH protenchel, I'd hate to see it fail.

number of helpful: 1 of 8 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2014
												I do not recommend this game even on sale (this review is made 2.5 months after initial release). Primarily because the user "interface" is really really poorly designed, despite all the nice looking screenshots and videos, this game is almost unplayable, it is more of a hassle fighting with the interface than it should / needs to be.This game's user interface is on the level of Sim Tower - i.e. non-existent, boring font and text, surrounded by boxes facts and numbers using standard Arial font. Certainly not acceptable in today's standards.Don't be fooled by the nice screenshots of the game running. You'll run the other way when you actually see how bad the interface is.There are many other reasons not to recommend this game.- Performance issue particularly when moving around the map. I have a AMD 290X, one of the top end graphics card money can buy at the moment and it stutters moving around a medium map on medium graphic settings.- Gameplay bugs, really basic things like coaches for some reason goes to the 2nd stop in a line instead of starting from the 1st once you start a new line. How can bugs like this still be in the game after how ever many patches it has since release?- Lack of WASD/Arrow key/edge of map movement consistency - it seems like sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Does it even have key bindings? Who knows.It simply isn't even worth the $20 sale price given the amount of time I spent in it before I've given up in frustration. Given that this game is considered "complete", has been released for some time and not an early access / alpha stage game, people should not put their hopes up that the developers will make this into a polished game with their gratis patching. If the developers proof me wrong, I'll gladly update and change this review. But at this moment in time, in my opinion it is a $5 game for effort, which is a big shame as it has so much potential. Will the developers unlock it, well if they were planning to I would've thought they should've released this as an Early Access. You probably don't want to pay to find out. I'd rather pay $120 for the Japanese version of A-Train 3.0 than any money towards some incomplete garbage. Even Cities in Motion 2, a game that is considered "rough around the edges" but complete, is hundrds of miles better than this "game".

												No, no , no..... Just why?I have been waiting for this game a long time, well only 2 month but if you like this kind of game every day waiting for it is painfull. Finally the release day arrived i instantly added this game to my library, without seen any reviews and so on...Now after 2 Hours i am dissapointet. Let me explain. The menue is horrible.Try to find a manual, i didnt found anything. Annoying Sound when a new vehicle is availible.Performance, yeah i know you proberbly have the uber l33t h33x0r system with 5GHz and double Octacore CPU and so on. No thats not the point. I have watched the frame drops when opening any information window.You start at 1850 and you are not able to chose any different starting date until you have reached that date. Means You have to start 1850 and then play until 1900 bevore you can chose that date as starting age. This is stupid, simply press fast forward after your loan is paid and wait for that date.... How to rorate things? I dont know since there is no manual found yet.Want a loan from the Bank? Ok, have fun clicking all the time there is no Shift/Alt/ctrl hotkey to increase the loan by10x or so. Takes some time ....Did i mention the graphic glitches? Hotkey confoguration? Nope.Advanced map settings? Nope.Advanced sifficulty settings? NOPEBus line creation is buggy, if there are to many crossroads near your bus stop. Start praying.Just 3 difficulty settings, which no one explains.Well, i think most of you guys dont like what i wrote, you simply wont agree, thats okay. But  you should consider the oposite side of your thoughts... If you do not state the bad things that could be fixed(Its not the gameplay itself i complain about!) No one will ever change it.And for those wo think, they made a good job, they are new in this industry, etc... Are you ♥♥♥♥ing kidding me? Only because you like this genre and there hasnt been a release of this genre since ages, you want me to close my eyes for on the bad things? Its a game like OpenTTD, everything reminds me on OpenTTD. Exept the graphics they are new. If you ask me, the game is worth the Price if the comany doesnt stop the developement of the game. We will see.

number of helpful: 0 of 6 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 15, 2014
												Very disappointed. Maybe I was expecting too much!  I prepurchased this after reading the early access reviews (though i was unable to gain early access! really must follow kickstarter more often).  And watching the teaser videos.  It looked so good! like Railroad Tycoon but, better.  Sorry, but it is not.  It is not even close to as enjoyable as RT3 is, it is, depressing.So here is a run down of what I worked on in the game.  Started with a small map, medium terrain and easy.  (as advised)I followed the tutorial to make a bus route in the larger town on the map.   Started making revenue.   Went off and watched 5 episodes of Breaking Bad as my wife wanted to revist the show.  Went to bed.   Woke next morning made 10 million!!!! Game finshed then.   Pretty much.Thought about and started to make a transport route to take  in some of that tasty commerce travellng (by foot) along the roads.  Can't build a road on a track that is already there,  huh,  Ok, building one alongsides is pointless and incredibly hard.  Flood the road with trucks after several infuriating attempts to set up a distribution point.   30 trucks.  6 episodes of Breaking bad return to more money!  ok now the game is finished?  Nope I want to do what is plastered all over the front.  Build the best rail network the world has ever seen!  Nope.  Infuriatingly unintuitive railtrack laying system that seems to have a default route that will burn through your millions as it carves its way over under and through the landscape with little or no ability of the player to work around obsticles.  Crossing rivers? yeah, maybe if the game allows it at that point,  have a selecton of bridges to choose from, only allowed to select the one the game lets you select.  Oh, and when you have built this track and laid out the right stations you have to spend a fortune maintaining the track and trains and the roods vehicles that deteriate over time sucking more of your hard earned money.  So I restart.  I have the best bus/tram route the world has ever seen!  I make Buckets of money every year!  I have no debt! I have no railway or commerce trucks.  I am so happy i unistalled the game.  Maybe after a year the game will have been worked on and finished, because it certainly isn't at this finished at this point.  Or, maybe the developers will bring out Train Feaver 2 for another $35 and it will have fixed all that was wrong in the first game.    I wanted to be happy with it, I really did.

number of helpful: 10 of 28 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2014
												I consider this being in alpha stage with very limited features and UI. Graphics are great, but that's all. With that much limited options, one cannot even think of comparing this game to openTTD, not even the orignal TTD.I haven't played much since the game is constantly crashing. At this point, I am very disappointed - I hope the devs are planning to improve the game.EDIT: A patch (the third probably) made the game playable for me. However, it just deepened my disappointment: when you finally grasp (or read somewhere on the net) how the cargo is actually moved around, it is a pain to construct anything more complicated. The construction tool is hard to use but you can manage to build something (although no crossings are allowed...) All the fun stops when you get something like "I can't find a way to my stop" from a train that was built in a depot just next to the line and has direct access to it. Pathfinding is a chapter for itslelf... There are still some other bugs like the trucks on distincts lines blocking each other at stations, which renders these stations useless for multiple lines. And more and more... so the feeling that the devs should charge for a full release is still around...:-(EDIT: build 6219. The devs are definitely working on the game - the performance is now much better. The UI is also somewhat improved, but there are still glitches like windows constantly opening out of view. Second sad thing is that your trucks can still get easily blocked: 4 lines at connected to a 4 platform large truck station often end up with 2 lines using the same platform (not a hard algorithm to get that right, hm?). You can try to remove stations so the linkink resets...which might help you until next change. But you usually get stuck again as the old linking is stil used for incoming trucks...On the other hand, some updates are cool, like the DLC and mods! Thumbs up for that. I hope I can change my review to recommend next time.

number of helpful: 2 of 11 people (18%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												MY REVIEW (personally)I DONT WRITE THAT to blame that game! I just write down my impressions , after playing that game a long time. Maybe it helps some ppl, who think about to buy that game.Yeah and i am not a native english speaker. So dont care about my typographical errors and others ;-)I use a new i7 CPU, 12gig RAM  and the new Gtx970 (4gig) under win7 ultimate 64bit. THE GAMES RUNS SLOW and i get under 20 FPS sometimes. I run FPS shooter with incredible grapik under ULTRA settings and full HD with 60FP+-. THAT MEANS:That game is really, really bad programmed!I played that game now for so many times. I wonder how addicted that thing made me. But i guess, its the luck for the programmer, that there are not alot other transportation games on the market like this in "transport tycoon style", so the gamer HAVE to choose this one. Otherwhise, it would not be worth to be played at all.FACTS:There are so many more bugs and issues. Clipping errors is one word. Trains cruise through private cars like ghosts, terraine modelling is aweful, looks like i would play a game from the 90's. We would need more resources, not only iron, oil, and some of the others. What about fruits and plantages? Or fish industry on the waters? Seems like the programmers had to hurry. And then the fitting cars for that resources? I have to use about 20 mods and dont have enough resources though...IT IS FACT, that this game has really problems with that game code, which couses unstability and bad performance (Game use 1 CPU core only, and this with bad code- feel free to google that), and you will know that problems by yourself, if you ever played that game more than a few hours.One big problem is, that most of this issues are "hardcoded", not easy to repair without coding the whole code new. :-(There are no tools at all in this game, which are already standard since years, like "underground few", when trying to build tunnels. Most of the time you get "collision" warnings while building something in that game world, but it is not shown where, and why. So it gets to a really frustrating work to connect two train stations or even simply roads!There are no options to build up real, working routing chains, especially passengers... Passengers dont use smart routing chains like they do in "Cities in motion" for example. Try to connect 3 buss routes togehter, it wont work well. They enter one transportation route and go to one other, or to their direct goal. Even they would be faster than walking, they dont use more lines. Tried this out may, many hours.When upgrading a road, most of the times i get a error messages on road crossings. So i have to crush the whole part and make a new one. I understand that- within cities, because of the insufficient place to make that road bigger, but outside, middle of nowhere, nothing in the way? Why cant i plant roads over train tracks? I have to crush that tracks, build a road and then build that track again... huh?And its nearly inpossible to construct a nice bridge within a city, it need so much space - and you'll get lots of error messages again.Today i tried to electrify an elder train track part. I needed 1/2 hour to find that small track part (about 1 milimeter) which was not clicked to get elecrityed, and so i got "no way found" messages in a row from my first electric train... A annoying klicking orgy, nothing in common with fun imho...There are NO options at all, to interact with cities. You cant pay for commercial to raise the stream of passengers, and so on. Why cant i build something like "attractions" or something else like this to get more tourists for my train routes! Oh, i forgot - THERE ARE NO TOURISTS! I know, this is a transportation game, not a city builder. But man, we have seen it could be done better in other games.Conclusion:If this game would be a game in beta state, which will be releases in the next 1-2 years, that game would wake my hopes. But like this, i have all the time the bad feeling, all the time the anger about this many mistakes in that game, that i really want play this but... I am faced all the time by irregularities, while playing that game. But i want fun, not getting angry all the time. There is a great potential, but unfortunately its not used at all. Its a half-hearted thing, but some german magazine testers gave so many good reviews about this game - but what for? Because its a small budged game? Because there are not many others of that kind of games? Maybe, i dont know at all. So its to say: its not THE transportation game, not even close to that. Maybe there will come some patches, that could help. Now at the moment i can't recommend that game.Regards,Tom

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												This game can best be described as an old woolly jumper. Not because it's nice and comforting but because the more the devs try to repair something, the more another part of it unravels. It's over a year since launch now and the game STILL needs major work, getting a patch on average once every two months, I get the feeling that the developers are fighting a loosing battle. It is still VERY badly optimised and you will need a REALLY GOOD system to run it properly, I have an AMD FX6350 running at 3.9ghz with a decent 'card and 16gb of RAM and my system struggles once I have more than a couple of lines setup.However, when it works, this is a great game and anyone interested in transport, trains, modeling or even puzzles will enjoy it. It's strangely addictive and relaxing to play, even with it's faults and even though it's progress is painfully slow, there have been vast improvements since launch. EDIT: Well, the devs have just announced that after just over a year of release, they are abandoning the game to work on a 'new project' and the next patch/update will the the last. Shocking lack of commitment and proves all the people who said they couldn't do what they promised all along were right.
